question: Which of the following Chola King assumed the title of Gangaikondachola?
explanation: Rajendra I in the year 1022 CE, led an expedition to the north. He followed the same route which was taken by the great conqueror Samudragupta and crossed Ganga. He defeated the Pala ruler, Mahipal I and the Western Chalukyas. He assumed the title of Gangaikondachola which means ‘the Chola conqueror of Ganga’ to commemorate this occasion.
